title: Convenient Online Purchases in U.K. and U.S.A. for Czech Citibank clients
summary: Prague - Beginning March 30, 2012 Citibank Europe plc is offering its client a new service called Globeshopper, enabling all holders of Citi payment cards issued in the Czech Republic to shop in more than 500 online stores in the U.K. and the U.S.A. Clients of Czech Citibank can shop conveniently from their homes at all merchants that do not usually accept payment cards issued in the Czech Republic and do not deliver goods to the Czech market. Registration for the Globeshopper service as well as purchase transactions are provided by Borderlinx free-of-charge to all Citi payment card holders.
tag-1: Convenient Online Purchases in U.K. and U.S.A. for Czech Citibank clients
tag-2: Prague – Beginning March 30, 2012 Citibank Europe plc is offering its client a new service called Globeshopper, enabling all holders of Citi payment cards issued in the Czech Republic to shop in more than 500 online stores in the U.K. and the U.S.A. Clients of Czech Citibank can shop conveniently from their homes at all merchants that do not usually accept payment cards issued in the Czech Republic and do not deliver goods to the Czech market. Registration for the Globeshopper service as well as purchase transactions are provided by Borderlinx free-of-charge to all Citi payment card holders.
tag-3: "Upon successful registration at Borderlinx web page http://www.borderlinx.com/globeshopper-cz a customer account is created together with a virtual mailing address in the U.K. or the U.S.A. registered with Borderlinx," says George Denisenko, Consumer Lending Head at Citibank in the Czech Republic. He adds: "All orders made by the client are sent to this address and are consequently mailed with a 10 percent discount on delivery fee to client's mailing address in the Czech Republic."
tag-4: Clients can choose receiving the order to their mailing address instantly (so called autoship) or they can shop together with their friends for 30 days and receive all purchased goods in one delivery package which saves them money on delivery fee (so called flexship).
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
